meanings.definition: The work or position of a butler.
meanings.sent1: In the grand mansion, the butlery was always immaculate and organized.
meanings.sent2: The butlery in the household was responsible for managing the staff and overseeing the household tasks.
meanings.sent3: The butlery was so well-kept that even the dust bunnies seemed to disappear in fear.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail in the butlery was like a symphony conductor directing every movement flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The butlery gleamed with such brilliance that it seemed to outshine even the chandeliers.

meanings.definition: The skills, duties, or characteristics associated with a butler.
meanings.sent1: His butlery included impeccable manners and a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent2: She admired the butlery of the butler, who always knew exactly what was needed before anyone asked.
meanings.sent3: The butlery of the butler was so impressive that even the cat behaved with utmost decorum in his presence.
meanings.sent4: Her butlery shone through in her ability to anticipate the needs of the guests before they even realized it themselves.
meanings.sent5: The butlery of the staff was so exceptional that it elevated the entire dining experience to a new level of sophistication.
